content: Do I need to have CUDA hardware installed at the time of compiling CUDA programs with nvcc in a Linux environment? Can I compile the programs on any system and run them only on systems with CUDA capability?

No, you do not need to have CUDA hardware installed at the time of compiling CUDA programs with `nvcc` in a Linux environment. You can compile CUDA programs on any system that has the CUDA Toolkit installed, regardless of whether it has a CUDA-capable GPU. The `nvcc` compiler translates the CUDA code into a binary that can be executed on a CUDA-capable GPU.

However, to actually run the compiled CUDA program, you will need a system with a CUDA-capable GPU and the appropriate NVIDIA drivers installed. This means you can compile your CUDA programs on a machine without a CUDA-capable GPU and then transfer the compiled binaries to a machine with the necessary hardware to execute them.
